intro: Condaliopsis lycioides var. canescens, commonly known as the hairy condaliopsis, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
